html:
Make your designs bounce, drop, swipe and more!
Weekly Newsletter
 Learn & be inspired
If you’re trying to get traction on social media—for your business, or maybe just your pet pug’s Instagram account—you’ll know what a crowded marketplace it is. Every minute of the day, hundreds of brands are posting content that practically screams “look at me!”

You already know the value of adding images to your posts—that’s probably what brought you to Canva in the first place. But if you want to get next-level engagement, you should get your designs moving with animation.

Here are three reasons you should make your next social media post an animation.

1. They draw the eye
With animation, your designs take on a whole new dimension. Movement grabs a viewer’s attention in a way a static image simply can’t. And in a busy social media feed, that’s a crucial point of difference.

2. They’re favored by social media algorithms
Ahh, the mysterious ways of “the algorithms”. Figuring out how to make the social media algorithms work for, rather than against you, can be headache inducing. Hot tip: posts containing videos and GIFS get higher levels of engagement (those likes and shares that you crave) and are more likely to be featured in your audience’s feed.

3. They’re surprisingly easy to make
They might look fancy, but that doesn’t mean they take hours—or hundreds of dollars—to create. With Canva’s Animator tool, you can bring your Canva designs to life with one simple click. Canva for Work subscribers will find it in the Publish menu. You can download your animation as a GIF or a movie. Not a Canva for Work subscriber? Then try your free, 30-day trial.

Magically animate my design
